page.title: 12APLEY ESTATE NR. KEMBERTON
page.content: Apley estate lies to the south east of Kemberton. The tenant Mr. Ward lives at Grindle House. His family also owns Havenhills farm which lies to the south of the village. For the purposes of administration and farming the 275 acres of Havenhills is included in the total acreage of the estate which is 925 acres. The estate is a mixed farm. It includes about 140 acres of potatoes, 150 of sugar beet, 110 of winter wheat 60 of winter barley, 50 of spring barley, 160 of grassland, some permanent pasture and leas, and 30 acres of non-commercial woodland. Corn is sold for seed or to flour mills, barley is kept for winter fodder and sugar beet is sold direct from the farm to merchants.
